title: Logical Operators Practice
instructions: Write functions using and, or, and not operators to combine conditions effectively.
solution:
def can_vote(age, is_citizen):
    """Return True if person can vote (18+ and citizen)"""
    return age >= 18 and is_citizen

def gets_discount(age, is_student, is_military):
    """Return True if eligible for discount (under 18, 65+, student, or military)"""
    return age < 18 or age >= 65 or is_student or is_military

def is_valid_password(password):
    """Return True if password is 8+ chars and contains both letters and numbers"""
    has_letter = any(c.isalpha() for c in password)
    has_number = any(c.isdigit() for c in password)
    return len(password) >= 8 and has_letter and has_number
hints: Use 'and' when all conditions must be true
Use 'or' when at least one condition must be true
You can use any() to check if any character matches a condition
